intro: Caruncularia simsii, commonly known as the dwarf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its small, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of purple and blue. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous annual, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are trailing or ascending. Caruncularia simsii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
